section_id: ## 12.3. The Complete Lyapunov Drift Under Cloning

hints.label: thm-complete-cloning-drift
hints.title: Complete Drift Inequality for the Cloning Operator
hints.content:
8094: :label: thm-complete-cloning-drift
8095: 
8096: Under the foundational axioms (Chapter 4), the cloning operator $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ (see {prf:ref}`def-cloning-operator-formal`) induces the following drift on the synergistic Lyapunov function:
8097: 
8098: $$
8099: V_{\text{total}}(S_1, S_2) = V_W(S_1, S_2) + c_V V_{\text{Var}}(S_1, S_2) + c_B W_b(S_1, S_2)
8100: $$
8101: 
8102: **Individual Component Drifts:**
8103: 
8104: $$
8105: \begin{aligned}
8106: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_W] &\leq C_W \quad &\text{(bounded expansion)} \\
8107: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] &\leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x \quad &\text{(strong contraction)} \\
8108: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] &\leq C_v \quad &\text{(bounded expansion)} \\
8109: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] &\leq -\kappa_b W_b + C_b \quad &\text{(strong contraction)}
8110: \end{aligned}
8111: $$
8112: 
8113: **Combined Drift:**
8114: 
8115: $$
8116: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{total}}] \leq C_W + c_V(-\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_v + C_x) + c_B(-\kappa_b W_b + C_b)
8117: $$
8118: 
8119: **Critical Property - Partial Contraction:**
8120: 
8121: When $V_{\text{Var},x}$ and $W_b$ are sufficiently large relative to the expansion terms, the drift becomes negative:
8122: 
8123: $$
8124: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{total}}] < 0 \quad \text{when } c_V V_{\text{Var},x} + c_B W_b > \frac{C_W + c_V(C_v + C_x) + c_B C_b}{\min(\kappa_x, \kappa_b)}
hints.section: ## 12.3. The Complete Lyapunov Drift Under Cloning
hints.raw_directive:
8091: ### 12.3.1. Main Result
8092: 
8093: :::{prf:theorem} Complete Drift Inequality for the Cloning Operator
8094: :label: thm-complete-cloning-drift
8095: 
8096: Under the foundational axioms (Chapter 4), the cloning operator $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ (see {prf:ref}`def-cloning-operator-formal`) induces the following drift on the synergistic Lyapunov function:
8097: 
8098: $$
8099: V_{\text{total}}(S_1, S_2) = V_W(S_1, S_2) + c_V V_{\text{Var}}(S_1, S_2) + c_B W_b(S_1, S_2)
8100: $$
8101: 
8102: **Individual Component Drifts:**
8103: 
8104: $$
8105: \begin{aligned}
8106: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_W] &\leq C_W \quad &\text{(bounded expansion)} \\
8107: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] &\leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x \quad &\text{(strong contraction)} \\
8108: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] &\leq C_v \quad &\text{(bounded expansion)} \\
8109: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] &\leq -\kappa_b W_b + C_b \quad &\text{(strong contraction)}
8110: \end{aligned}
8111: $$
8112: 
8113: **Combined Drift:**
8114: 
8115: $$
8116: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{total}}] \leq C_W + c_V(-\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_v + C_x) + c_B(-\kappa_b W_b + C_b)
8117: $$
8118: 
8119: **Critical Property - Partial Contraction:**
8120: 
8121: When $V_{\text{Var},x}$ and $W_b$ are sufficiently large relative to the expansion terms, the drift becomes negative:
8122: 
8123: $$
8124: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{total}}] < 0 \quad \text{when } c_V V_{\text{Var},x} + c_B W_b > \frac{C_W + c_V(C_v + C_x) + c_B C_b}{\min(\kappa_x, \kappa_b)}
8125: $$

hints.label: proof-thm-complete-cloning-drift
hints.content:
8129: :::{prf:proof}
8130: :label: proof-thm-complete-cloning-drift
8131: **Proof.**
8132: 
8133: The total drift is obtained by summing the component drifts with their respective weights:
8134: 
8135: $$
8136: \begin{aligned}
8137: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{total}}] &= \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_W] + c_V \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var}}] + c_B \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] \\
8138: &= \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_W] + c_V (\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] + \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}]) + c_B \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b]
8139: \end{aligned}
8140: $$
8141: 
8142: Substituting the individual bounds from Theorems 10.3.1, 10.4.1, 11.3.1, and 12.2.1:
8143: 
8144: $$
8145: \leq C_W + c_V(-\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x + C_v) + c_B(-\kappa_b W_b + C_b)
8146: $$
8147: 
8148: Rearranging:
8149: 
8150: $$
8151: = -c_V \kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} - c_B \kappa_b W_b + (C_W + c_V C_x + c_V C_v + c_B C_b)
8152: $$
8153: 
8154: For the drift to be negative, we need the contraction terms to dominate:
8155: 
8156: $$
8157: c_V \kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + c_B \kappa_b W_b > C_W + c_V C_x + c_V C_v + c_B C_b
8158: $$
8159: 
8160: This holds when the weighted variance and boundary potential are sufficiently large.

hints.label: prop-kinetic-necessity
hints.title: Necessity of the Kinetic Operator
hints.content:
8198: :label: prop-kinetic-necessity
8199: 
8200: The cloning operator alone cannot guarantee convergence to a quasi-stationary distribution. Specifically:
8201: 
8202: 1. **Velocity variance accumulation:** The bounded expansion $+C_v$ per step can accumulate without bound over infinite time if not countered.
8203: 
8204: 2. **Inter-swarm divergence:** The bounded expansion $+C_W$ means the two coupled swarms can drift arbitrarily far apart without inter-swarm correction.
8205: 
8206: 3. **No velocity equilibrium:** Cloning has no mechanism to dissipate kinetic energy toward a target distribution - it only redistributes it through collisions.
8207: 
8208: Therefore, the **kinetic operator is essential** to:
8209: - Contract $V_{\text{Var},v}$ via Langevin friction (overcoming $C_v$)

hints.raw_directive:
8195: ### 12.3.3. Why Cloning Alone Cannot Achieve Convergence
8196: 
8197: :::{prf:proposition} Necessity of the Kinetic Operator
8198: :label: prop-kinetic-necessity
8199: 
8200: The cloning operator alone cannot guarantee convergence to a quasi-stationary distribution. Specifically:
8201: 
8202: 1. **Velocity variance accumulation:** The bounded expansion $+C_v$ per step can accumulate without bound over infinite time if not countered.
8203: 
8204: 2. **Inter-swarm divergence:** The bounded expansion $+C_W$ means the two coupled swarms can drift arbitrarily far apart without inter-swarm correction.
8205: 
8206: 3. **No velocity equilibrium:** Cloning has no mechanism to dissipate kinetic energy toward a target distribution - it only redistributes it through collisions.
8207: 
8208: Therefore, the **kinetic operator is essential** to:
8209: - Contract $V_{\text{Var},v}$ via Langevin friction (overcoming $C_v$)
8210: - Contract $V_W$ via hypocoercive drift and confining potential (overcoming $C_W$)
